awards.title: Holland Scholarship Award
awards.description:
Scholarship for international students from outside the European Economic Area (EEA).
The Holland Scholarship is a scholarship provided by the Dutch ministry of Education, Culture and Science and the 48 participating Dutch Research Universities and Universities of applied sciences. The scholarship is a financial contribution towards the costs of living, and is meant for excellent students who are applying for the first year of a Master’s programme in the Netherlands.
awards.issuer: Dutch Ministry of Education, Culture and Science

awards.title: VU Fellowship Programme (VUFP) Scholarship Award
awards.description:
Scholarship for international students from outside the European Economic Area (EEA).
The VU Fellowship Programme (VUFP) is a scholarship provided by the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam. The scholarship covers a tuition fee waiver of 16.830 EUR and is meant to encourage talented students to enroll in a Master’s programme at Vrije Universiteit.

awards.title: Academic Honors Diploma in Law School - PUCRS
awards.description: I have been conferred an Academic Honors Diploma due to my academic performance, in which I achieved a 9,429/10 as an overall average.

awards.title: Full Scholarship Award Based on Merit Average - PUCRS
awards.description: I was awarded by the Pontifical Catholic University of Rio Grande do Sul, ranked by QS Latin America University Rankings 2021 as one of the best Universities in Latin America, with a full scholarship to pursue the whole law bachelor’s degree since I achieved the highest score in the entrance exam among all the candidates.

profile_positions.description: The ESG team supports companies in the transformation to a sustainable business model. Sustainable reporting, assurance related to non-financial information, development of a fully integrated ESG strategy, and operations. Application of EU regulatory frameworks such as CSRD.
profile_positions.title: Trainee

profile_positions.description: The Climate Change and Sustainability Law Clinic of the Vrije Universiteit (VU) Amsterdam was established in 2021 as the first law clinic in Europe fully dedicated to the promotion of climate justice via legal action. The Clinic is an initiative bringing together students and nonprofit organizations interested in the strategic use of law towards just climate action.
profile_positions.title: Climate Change and Sustainability Law Clinic - Legal Researcher

profile_positions.description: Worked with Dutch businesses to identify and develop circular economy opportunities while promoting knowledge and innovation exchange on an international scale. Collaboration with the Dutch government and Netherlands Enterprise Agency to advance the Sustainable Development Goals. Conducted data analysis, non- financial reporting, managed stakeholder relationships and publications.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.location: Porto Alegre, Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil
profile_positions.description: After a career break from September/21 to January/22, during which I dedicated time to personal projects and embarked on a personal development journey in Greece and Italy, including a yoga training program, I rejoined Rafael Pandolfo Associated Lawyers for a focused 6-month engagement on a specific agro-related tax project.
profile_positions.title: Tax Lawyer

profile_positions.location: Porto Alegre, Rio Grande do Sul, Brasil
profile_positions.description: From January-on, after obtaining my law degree and passing the bar exam, I was promoted to junior tax consultant and began to work among the consultant area, where I developed tax solutions for clients and managed projects related to tax policy, tax reporting and corporate tax matters.
profile_positions.title: Tax Lawyer

profile_positions.location: Porto Alegre, Rio Grande do Sul, Brasil
profile_positions.description: I started at Rafael Pandolfo Advogados Associados as a personal intern of Mister Rafael Pandolfo, helping him with academic projects and research related to tax matters.
profile_positions.title: Tax Internship

profile_positions.location: Porto Alegre, Rio Grande do Sul, Brasil

Financial Supporter: Institutional Program of Scientific Initiation Scholarships – Pibic/CNPq, under the guidance of Professor Marco Félix Jobim (phD).

company.name: Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul

volunteer_experiences.description:
Having completed a Yoga Teacher Program in Greece, I taught weekly vinyasa yoga classes and managed social media for the Yoga para Todxs (Yoga for All) program to share the benefits of yoga with the local community.
The "Yoga for All" is an Extension Program from the Physical Education School of the Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul that aims to offer Yoga practices to the neediest and cultivate spaces for talks and reflection.

I developed and applied extracurricular activities in public schools and co-managed the project's administrative tasks with my colleagues.
Projeto Cambia is an NGO that links undergraduate and recent graduates with public elementary school students in Brazil. The project delivers weekly modules in the public schools, fostering intellectual, scientific, critical, and personal growth in the students.

During the 1-month I lived in London, I did travels by foot to rescue same-day food from restaurants and cafes, before delivering the food direct to charities and schools. 
The Felix Project is a London-based food redistribution waste charity set up in 2016 to tackle both issues.

During 2 semesters of law school, I worked in legal consultancy, case strategy development, legal drafts and petitions filling to help the local community.
The Legal Assistance Clinic (SAJUG) is a Project from the Pontifical Catholic University of Rio Grande do Sul (PUCRS) that provides pro bono/free legal services to the local vulnerable community.

company.name: Pontifícia Universidade Católica do Rio Grande do Sul

volunteer_experiences.description: Conducted field research under the guidance of Professor Márcia Andrea Buhring (PhD), presented orally at the X Ibero-American Congress of University Teaching, and co-authored the resulting article titled "Analysis of (I)migration and the New Migration Law no. 13.445/17”.
